Diagnosis
	1. Malignant pleural mesothelioma (biphasic type)
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	12 Jan 2024 Video-assisted thoracoscopic pleural biopsy

	Chemotherapy
	1. Carboplatin/Pemetrexed - 2 cycles completed (Jan-Feb 2024)
	2. Nivolumab commenced March 2024

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease with worsening pleural effusion

	Current issues
	1. Increasing dyspnoea
	2. Right-sided chest pain
	3. Progressive weight loss

	Summary of consultation
	This 68-year-old gentleman with biphasic mesothelioma has unfortunately shown disease progression despite first-line chemotherapy. Initial diagnosis followed investigation of right-sided pleural effusion, with VATS biopsy confirming biphasic mesothelioma (PD-L1 TPS 60%). He completed 2 cycles of carboplatin/pemetrexed but developed grade 3 thrombocytopenia requiring admission. CT showed progressive disease with increasing pleural mass and effusion.

He commenced second-line nivolumab in March 2024 but has shown clinical deterioration with worsening dyspnoea, now requiring 3L oxygen at rest. Recent CT shows further progression with extensive pleural disease and increasing effusion despite recent therapeutic aspiration.

Performance status has declined to ECOG 3. He requires assistance with most activities of daily living and spends >50% of time in bed. Weight has dropped from 82kg to 74kg over 8 weeks despite nutritional supplements.

	Further investigations
	Urgent CT scan arranged for next week

	Medication prescribed
	Oxycodone MR 30mg BD
Pregabalin 75mg BD
Dexamethasone 4mg OD

	Follow up
	Urgent referral made to local palliative care team
Transfer of care to [redacted name] Hospital palliative care unit arranged

	Required GP actions
	Please monitor oxygen requirements and adjust PRN medications as needed
Please support palliative care referral
